title: cmd
text:
cmd





Name
Description




configure_logging
Configure logging.


get_cmdline_args
Parse command line arguments and configure logger.


kimmdy
Run KIMMDY from the command line.


kimmdy_run
Run KIMMDY from python.






cmd.configure_logging(args, color=False)
Configure logging.
Configures the logging module with optional colorcodes for the terminal.



cmd.get_cmdline_args()
Parse command line arguments and configure logger.





Type
Description




Namespace
parsed command line arguments







cmd.kimmdy()
Run KIMMDY from the command line.
The configuration is gathered from the input file, which is kimmdy.yml by default.



cmd.kimmdy_run(input=Path('kimmdy.yml'), loglevel='DEBUG', logfile=Path('kimmdy.log'), checkpoint='', concat=False)
Run KIMMDY from python.

title: get_object
text:
get_object(path, object_name=None, parser='numpy', load_aliases=True, dynamic=False, loader=None)
Fetch a griffe object.











Name
Type
Description
Default




path
str
An import path to the object. This should have the form path.to.module:object. For example, quartodoc:get_object or quartodoc:MdRenderer.render.
required


object_name
str | None
(Deprecated). A function name.
None


parser
str
A docstring parser to use.
'numpy'


load_aliases

For aliases that were imported from other modules, should we load that module?
True


dynamic

Whether to dynamically import object. Useful if docstring is not hard-coded, but was set on object by running python code.
False






preview: print a user-friendly preview of a griffe object.



>>> get_function("quartodoc", "get_function")
<Function('get_function', ...

title: utils
text:
utils





Name
Description




check_gmx_version
Check for an existing gromacs installation.


check_idx



find_radical_pos
Calculates possible radical positions of a given radical atom


float_or_str



get_atominfo_from_plumedid
returns atomtypes for a plumedid with information from the plumed and topology file


get_bondprm_from_atomtypes
returns bond parameters (b0, kb, E_dis) for a set of atomtypes


get_data_from_file



get_gmx_dir
returns the path to the gromacs installation


get_shell_stdout



identify_atomtypes



increment_logfile



morse_transition_rate
calculates energy barrier crossing rate [in ps]; barrier based on the model V = V_morse - F*X


pushd



run_gmx



run_shell_cmd



sort_angle



sort_bond



sort_dihedral



sort_improper



store_linelist_to_file



str_to_int_or_0



write_conditions_in_plumedfile






utils.check_gmx_version(config)
Check for an existing gromacs installation.
If PLUMED is meant to be used it additionally checks for the keyword ‘MODIFIED’ in the version name.



utils.check_idx(object)



utils.find_radical_pos(center, bonded, tetrahedral=False)
Calculates possible radical positions of a given radical atom











Name
Type
Description
Default




center
MDAnalysis.core.groups.Atom
Radical atom
required


bonded
MDAnalysis.core.groups.AtomGroup
Atom group of bonded atoms. From its length the geometry is predicted.
required


tetrahedral
bool
Whether to assume a tetrahedral conformation around C and N
False









Type
Description




list
List of radical positions, three dimensional arrays







utils.float_or_str(elem)



utils.get_atominfo_from_plumedid(plumedid, plumed, top)
returns atomtypes for a plumedid with information from the plumed and topology file



utils.get_bondprm_from_atomtypes(atomtypes, ffbonded, lookup_edissoc_atomtype)
returns bond parameters (b0, kb, E_dis) for a set of atomtypes



utils.get_data_from_file(filepath)



utils.get_gmx_dir()
returns the path to the gromacs installation



utils.get_shell_stdout(s)



utils.identify_atomtypes(filepath)



utils.increment_logfile(f)



utils.morse_transition_rate(r_curr, r_0, E_dis, k_f, k_0=0.288, kT=2.479)
calculates energy barrier crossing rate [in ps]; barrier based on the model V = V_morse - F*X



utils.pushd(path)



utils.run_gmx(s, cwd=None)



utils.run_shell_cmd(s, cwd=None)



utils.sort_angle(entry)



utils.sort_bond(entry)



utils.sort_dihedral(entry)



utils.sort_improper(entry)



utils.store_linelist_to_file(data, filepath)



utils.str_to_int_or_0(elem)



utils.write_conditions_in_plumedfile(topfile, indexfile, indexgroup, outplumed)

title: parsing
text:
parsing





Name
Description




GMX_BUILTIN_FF_DIR



TopologyDict










Name
Description




create_subsections



is_not_comment



read_distances_dat
Read a distances.dat plumed output file.


read_edissoc
reads a edissoc file and turns it into a dict.


read_plumed
Read a plumed.dat configuration file.


read_rtp



read_top
Parse a list of lines from a topology file.


read_xml_ff



resolve_includes
Resolve #include statements in a (top/itp) file.


write_plumed
Write a plumed.dat configuration file.


write_top






parsing.create_subsections(ls)



parsing.is_not_comment(c)



parsing.read_distances_dat(distances_dat)
Read a distances.dat plumed output file.



parsing.read_edissoc(path)
reads a edissoc file and turns it into a dict. the tuple of bond atoms make up the key, the dissociation energy E_dissoc [kJ mol-1] is the value



parsing.read_plumed(path)
Read a plumed.dat configuration file.



parsing.read_rtp(path)



parsing.read_top(path)
Parse a list of lines from a topology file.





Name
Type
Description
Default




path
Path
Path to the topology file.
required







#include statements will be resolved
comments will be removed
all lines are stripped of leading and trailing whitespace
#undef is not supported
a section within ifdef may be a subsection of a section that was started outside of the ifdef
#if..#endif statements only surround a full section or subsection, not individual lines within a section and a section may either be contained within if … else or it may not be, but it can not be duplicated with one part inside and one outside.
if .. else can’t be nested
#include s that don’t resolve to a valid file path are silently dropped
sections that can have subsections can also exist multiple, separate times e.g. moleculetype will appear multiple times and they should not be merged





parsing.read_xml_ff(path)



parsing.resolve_includes(path)
Resolve #include statements in a (top/itp) file. Returns a tuple with the list of lines and the Path to the ff directory.



parsing.write_plumed(d, path)
Write a plumed.dat configuration file.



parsing.write_top(top, outfile)

title: Dihedral
text:
Dihedral
topology.atomic.Dihedral(ai, aj, ak, al, funct, c0=None, c1=None, c2=None, c3=None, c4=None, c5=None)
Information about one dihedral
A class containing bond information as in the dihedrals section of the topology. Proper dihedrals have funct 9. Improper dihedrals have funct 4.
From gromacs topology: ‘;’, ‘ai’, ‘aj’, ‘ak’, ‘al’, ‘funct’, ‘c0’, ‘c1’, ‘c2’, ‘c3’, ‘c4’, ‘c5’ For proper dihedrals (funct 9): aj < ak For improper dihedrals (funct 4): no guaranteed order




 Back to top

title: topology.atomic.DihedralType
text:
topology.atomic.DihedralType(i, j, k, l, id, id_sym, funct, c0, c1, periodicity, c3=None, c4=None, c5=None)
Information about one dihedral
A class containing bond information as in the dihedrals section of the topology. Proper dihedrals have funct 9. Improper dihedrals have funct 4.
Note that proper dihedrals of type 9 can be defined multiple times, for different periodicities. This is why would-be parameter c2 is called periodicity and part of the id.
From gromacs topology: ‘;’, ‘i’, ‘j’, ‘k’, ‘l’, ‘funct’, ‘c0’, ‘c1’, ‘periodicity’, ‘c3’, ‘c4’, ‘c5’ Where i,j,k,l are atomtypes





Name
Description




from_top_line






topology.atomic.DihedralType.from_top_line(cls, l)

misc_helper.concat_traj(run_dir, out=None, run_types=None)
Find and concatenate trajectories from KIMMDY runs.











Name
Type
Description
Default




run_dir
pathlib.Path | str
Directory containing directories of multiple tasks.
required


out
Path
File Path into the output trr will be written. Default concat.trr in given run_dir
None


run_types
list
List of tasks to get trrs from. If a task is not in this list it will be skipped. By default None
None







misc_helper.edgelist_to_dot_graph(ls, overlap='true')



misc_helper.top_to_graph(top, overlap='true')



misc_helper.topology_to_edgelist(top)

title: misc_helper
text:
Name
Description




concat_traj
Find and concatenate trajectories from KIMMDY runs.


edgelist_to_dot_graph



top_to_graph



topology_to_edgelist






misc_helper.concat_traj(run_dir, out=None, run_types=None)
Find and concatenate trajectories from KIMMDY runs.











Name
Type
Description
Default




run_dir
pathlib.Path | str
Directory containing directories of multiple tasks.
required


out
Path
File Path into the output trr will be written. Default concat.trr in given run_dir
None


run_types
list
List of tasks to get trrs from. If a task is not in this list it will be skipped. By default None
None

misc_helper.top_to_graph(top, overlap='true')

title: DihedralType
text:
DihedralType
topology.atomic.DihedralType(i, j, k, l, id, id_sym, funct, c0, c1, periodicity, c3=None, c4=None, c5=None)
Information about one dihedral
A class containing bond information as in the dihedrals section of the topology. Proper dihedrals have funct 9. Improper dihedrals have funct 4.
Note that proper dihedrals of type 9 can be defined multiple times, for different periodicities. This is why would-be parameter c2 is called periodicity and part of the id.
From gromacs topology: ‘;’, ‘i’, ‘j’, ‘k’, ‘l’, ‘funct’, ‘c0’, ‘c1’, ‘periodicity’, ‘c3’, ‘c4’, ‘c5’ Where i,j,k,l are atomtypes




 Back to top

title: kmc
text:
kmc





Name
Description




frm
First Reaction Method variant of Kinetic Monte Carlo.


rf_kmc
Rejection-Free Monte Carlo.





kmc.frm(recipe_collection, rng=default_rng(), MD_time=None)
First Reaction Method variant of Kinetic Monte Carlo. takes RecipeCollection and choses a recipe based on which reaction would occur.











Name
Type
Description
Default




reaction_result

from which one will be choosen
required


rng
numpy.random.BitGenerator
to generate random numbers in the KMC step
default_rng()


MD_time
typing.Union[float, None]
to compare conformational events with reaction events in the time domain
None







kmc.rf_kmc(recipe_collection, rng=default_rng())
Rejection-Free Monte Carlo. takes RecipeCollection and choses a recipe based on the relative propensity of the events.











Name
Type
Description
Default




reaction_result

from which one will be choosen
required


rng
numpy.random.BitGenerator
to generate random numbers in the KMC step
default_rng()

title: topology.atomic
text:
topology.atomic
Atomic datatypes for the topology such as Atom, Bond, Angle, Dihedral, etc. The order of the fields comes from the gromacs topology file format. See https://manual.gromacs.org/current/reference-manual/topologies/topology-file-formats.html#topology-file

Description

AtomId



Atomic



AtomicType



AtomicTypes



BondId

title: topology.topology.Topology
text:
topology.topology.Topology(self, top, ffpatch=None)
Smart container for parsed topology data.
A topology keeps track of connections and applies patches to parameters when bonds are broken or formed. Assumptions: - the topology of interest (the protein) is in section ‘moleculetype_0’.











Name
Type
Description
Default




top
TopologyDict
A dictionary containing the parsed topology data.
required


ffpatch
typing.Optional[pathlib.Path]
Path to a force field patch file. If None, no patching is applied.
None









Name
Description




bind_bond
Add a bond in topology.


break_bond
Break bonds in topology.


move_hydrogen
Move a singly bound atom to a new location.


patch_parameters



reindex_atomnrs
Reindex atom numbers in topology.


to_dict






topology.topology.Topology.bind_bond(self, atompair_nrs)
Add a bond in topology.
Modifies the topology dictionary in place. It keeps track of affected terms in the topology via a graph representation of the topology and applies the necessary changes to bonds, angles and dihedrals (proper and improper). Furthermore, it modifies to function types in the topology to account for radicals.











Name
Type
Description
Default




atompair

A tuple of integers with the atoms indices (id, starting at 1) with from, the atom being moved and to, the atom to which the from atom will be bound
required







topology.topology.Topology.break_bond(self, atompair_nrs)
Break bonds in topology.
removes bond, angles and dihedrals where atompair was involved. Modifies the topology dictionary in place.



topology.topology.Topology.move_hydrogen(self, from_to)
Move a singly bound atom to a new location.
This is typically H for Hydrogen Atom Transfer (HAT).



topology.topology.Topology.patch_parameters(self, focus_nr)



topology.topology.Topology.reindex_atomnrs(self)
Reindex atom numbers in topology.
Starts at index 1. This also updates the numbers for bonds, angles, dihedrals and pairs.



topology.topology.Topology.to_dict(self)

title: topology.topology.Topology
text:
Name
Type
Description
Default




top
TopologyDict
A dictionary containing the parsed topology data.
required


ffpatch
typing.Optional[pathlib.Path]
Path to a force field patch file. If None, no patching is applied.
None

title: Getting Started
text:
Let’s jump right in!





python3.9 or higher
gromacs (tested with version >= 2020.4)

Optional:

plumed-patched version of gromacs





Create a file:


kimmdy.yml

dryrun: false
iterations: 100
name: 'hat_tf_000'
gromacs_alias: 'gmx'
top: 'Ala_out.top'
gro: 'npt.gro'
ndx: 'index.ndx'
mds:
  equilibrium:
    mdp: 'md.mdp'
  relax:
    mdp: 'md_slow.mdp'
changer:
  coordinates:
    md: 'relax'      
reactions:
  hat_reaction:
    frequency_factor: 100000000
    h_cutoff: 3
    polling_rate: 1

sequence:
- equilibrium
- mult: 2
  tasks:
  - equilibrium

title: Getting Started
text:
python3.9 or higher
gromacs (tested with version >= 2020.4)

Optional:

plumed-patched version of gromacs

title: Getting Started
text:
Create a file:


kimmdy.yml

dryrun: false
iterations: 100
name: 'hat_tf_000'
gromacs_alias: 'gmx'
top: 'Ala_out.top'
gro: 'npt.gro'
ndx: 'index.ndx'
mds:
  equilibrium:
    mdp: 'md.mdp'
  relax:
    mdp: 'md_slow.mdp'
changer:
  coordinates:
    md: 'relax'      
reactions:
  hat_reaction:
    frequency_factor: 100000000
    h_cutoff: 3
    polling_rate: 1

sequence:
- equilibrium
- mult: 2
  tasks:
  - equilibrium

title: Hexala topology
text:
Hexala

from kimmdy.parsing import read_top
from kimmdy.topology.topology import Topology
from pathlib import Path
from kimmdy.misc_helper import top_to_graph


ala_top = read_top(Path('../tests/test_files/test_topology/hexala.top'))
top = Topology(ala_top)

ls = top_to_graph(top) 
with open("ala-top.dot", "w") as f:
  f.writelines(ls)
